rubric.description: This rubric evaluates student essays based on five criteria, each scored from 1 to 4 (Poor=1, Fair=2, Good=3, Excellent=4). Scores are summed for a total out of 20 points.

criteria.name: Thesis and Argument
criteria.description: Clarity, focus, and strength of the main claim or thesis statement.

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Thesis is clear, insightful, and effectively guides the entire essay with a strong, original argument.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Thesis is clear and focused, with a solid argument that adequately addresses the prompt.

levels.label: Fair
levels.description: Thesis is present but lacks clarity, focus, or full relevance to the prompt.

levels.label: Poor
levels.description: No clear thesis, or the argument is absent, irrelevant, or severely underdeveloped.

criteria.name: Organization and Coherence
criteria.description: Logical structure, flow, and use of transitions to connect ideas.

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Essay is exceptionally well-organized with seamless transitions and a coherent progression of ideas.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Clear structure with effective transitions; ideas flow logically overall.

levels.label: Fair
levels.description: Basic organization present, but some sections feel disjointed or transitions are weak.

levels.label: Poor
levels.description: Lacks logical structure; ideas are disorganized or jump abruptly without connections.

criteria.name: Development and Support
criteria.description: Use of evidence, examples, and sources to develop and support claims.

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Rich, relevant evidence from credible sources, integrated smoothly to strongly support the argument.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Adequate evidence and examples that effectively support main points.

levels.label: Fair
levels.description: Some support provided, but evidence is limited, underdeveloped, or not fully integrated.

levels.label: Poor
levels.description: Little to no evidence or support; claims are unsubstantiated or irrelevant.

criteria.name: Critical Analysis and Understanding
criteria.description: Depth of analysis, critical thinking, and engagement with the topic or readings.

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Demonstrates sophisticated analysis with original insights and deep engagement with the material.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Solid analysis with clear interpretation and appropriate engagement with the topic.

levels.label: Fair
levels.description: Basic analysis present, but lacks depth or critical insight.

levels.label: Poor
levels.description: Minimal or no analysis; shows superficial understanding or misunderstanding of the material.

criteria.name: Language, Style, and Mechanics
criteria.description: Clarity, grammar, diction, sentence variety, and adherence to conventions.

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Polished, engaging prose with precise language, varied sentences, and no errors.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Clear and effective language with minor errors that do not distract.

levels.label: Fair
levels.description: Readable but with noticeable errors in grammar, style, or mechanics that affect clarity.

levels.label: Poor
levels.description: Frequent errors in grammar, spelling, or style that hinder comprehension.
